channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Millions of immigrants are now in legal limbo amid the asylum freeze
item.description: Millions of immigrants in the U.S. who have applied for asylum are now in legal limbo after President Trump paused decisions on all asylum cases. Even some Republican lawmakers now are pushing back.
item.content:encoded: Millions of immigrants in the U.S. who have applied for asylum are now in legal limbo after President Trump paused decisions on all asylum cases. Even some Republican lawmakers now are pushing back.
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: As threats grow, 'parasol patrol' provides security for Drag Story Hour
item.description: Drag Story Hour, where drag performers read to kids, has weathered attacks and threats over the years. In Denver, a volunteer "parasol patrol" provides security to families attending Drag Story Hour.
item.content:encoded: Drag Story Hour, where drag performers read to kids, has weathered attacks and threats over the years. In Denver, a volunteer "parasol patrol" provides security to families attending Drag Story Hour.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Sedley

item.title: Only two species can survive in Great Salt Lake? Scientist says — hold my Nalgene
item.description: Scientist Julie Jung set out on a hike along the Great Salt Lake to find nematodes. She ended up discovering a new species.
item.content:encoded: Scientist Julie Jung set out on a hike along the Great Salt Lake to find nematodes. She ended up discovering a new species.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: Nick Reiner is charged with two counts of first degree murder
item.description: Nick Reiner remains in police custody as prosecutors are expected to announce charges related to the death of his parents, Hollywood director Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer Reiner.
item.content:encoded: Nick Reiner remains in police custody as prosecutors are expected to announce charges related to the death of his parents, Hollywood director Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer Reiner.
item.dc:creator: Steve Futterman

item.title: The U.S. has long had interest in Venezuelan oil, but that's not all
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Francisco Monaldi, the director of the Latin American Energy Program at the Baker Institute at Rice University about the U.S.'s long interest in Venezuela's oil industry.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Francisco Monaldi, the director of the Latin American Energy Program at the Baker Institute at Rice University about the U.S.'s long interest in Venezuela's oil industry.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Marquez Janse

item.title: How college campus security has changed to prepare for violent attacks
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Rob Kilfoyle, president of the International Association of Campus Law Enforcement Administrators, about evolving safety standards on college campuses.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Rob Kilfoyle, president of the International Association of Campus Law Enforcement Administrators, about evolving safety standards on college campuses.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: The sons of the Allman Brothers band members go on tour to honor their fathers
item.description: Honoring their fathers, the sons of the Allman Brothers band members go on tour during the Holiday season as the Allman Betts Family Revival.
item.content:encoded: Honoring their fathers, the sons of the Allman Brothers band members go on tour during the Holiday season as the Allman Betts Family Revival.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Goodwin

item.title: What to know from Susie Wiles' interviews with 'Vanity Fair,' according to the writer
item.description: Throughout the year, Vanity Fair writer Chris Whipple interviewed some of the people closest to President Trump. We speak with Whipple about his talks with White House chief of staff, Susie Wiles.
item.content:encoded:
Throughout the year, Vanity Fair writer Chris Whipple interviewed some of the people closest to President Trump. We speak with Whipple about his talks with White House chief of staff, Susie Wiles.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Elena Burnett

item.title: British doctors to go on strike during a flu outbreak
item.description: Doctors in England say they'll go on strike Wednesday. Their five-day action coincides with a spike in flu cases. The government says crowded hospitals are preparing for a "worst case scenario."
item.content:encoded: Doctors in England say they'll go on strike Wednesday. Their five-day action coincides with a spike in flu cases. The government says crowded hospitals are preparing for a "worst case scenario."
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: How responders, victims are doing 1 year after Abundant Life Christian School shooting
item.description: Some of the first responders and medical workers who helped when the Abundant Life Christian School shooting took place in Madison, Wisc., are still dealing with difficult feelings one year later.
item.content:encoded: Some of the first responders and medical workers who helped when the Abundant Life Christian School shooting took place in Madison, Wisc., are still dealing with difficult feelings one year later.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Lehr
